H0.text: A balance and a ruler are the best tools for a baker to measure both the volume and temperature of the water when he prepares the dough by mixing 2 cups of flour with 1 cup of water that must be 85 °F.

H1.text: A balance and a thermometer are the best tools for the baker to measure both the volume and temperature of the water needed when he mixes 2 cups of flour with 1 cup of water at 85°F.

H2.text: A measuring cup and a balance are the best tools for a baker to measure the 1 cup volume of water at 85°F and weigh the 2 cups of flour when preparing dough for bread.

H3.text: A measuring cup and a thermometer are the best tools for the baker to measure both the volume and temperature of the water when he prepares dough by mixing 2 cups of flour with 1 cup of water that must be 85°F.

A4.text: Liquid measure cups tend to be microwave safe for heating and clear to more easily judge the meniscus.

A5.text: In cooking disciplines such as baking, where accurate measurements are important, ingredients are instead measured by weight.

A6.text: The measuring cup design keeps a perfect ratio of surface area to volume, for consistent accuracy.
